message.raw:
Removed print statements from main.pyw and front_panel_settings.py

Fixed error handling of step size adjustment dialog when an invalid number was given. Added functionality so that hitting enter submits the dialog (equal to clicking OK)

Added right click context menu to spinbutton up/down buttons. This also prevents the default behaviour of the up/down buttons, which is to set the spinbutton to it's upper or lower limit respectively.

For those reading this log, I've also discovered that middle clicking the up/down button adjusts the spinbutton value by the "page size" which is always set to 10 times the step size.

message.raw: Fixed bugs in NI 6363 buffered mode. Discovered that buffered mode fails if there is no digital output in the labscript run, this is because the PFI used for clock ticks never gets freed from its current task. Stopping the task regardless of whether there is buffered DO doesn't seem to help, in order for the PFI to become available it appears another digital task actually needs to start. That doesn't make sense, so I'll look into it. We should be able to free the PFI without having to start a fake DO task, overriding the manual mode values.
message.html: Fixed bugs in NI 6363 buffered mode. Discovered that buffered mode fails if there is no digital output in the labscript run, this is because the PFI used for clock ticks never gets freed from its current task. Stopping the task regardless of whether there is buffered DO doesn't seem to help, in order for the PFI to become available it appears another digital task actually needs to start. That doesn't make sense, so I'll look into it. We should be able to free the PFI without having to start a fake DO task, overriding the manual mode values.

message.raw:
Now moved BLACS opening/closing to use the new settings format.

This may be very very broken at the moment, so I suggest not using this revision unless you know what you are doing.

Restore from settings h5 file should approximately work, though I haven't tested the logic yet so bad states could potentially be restored if the connection table has changed. Will test soon.

Theoretically the pulseblaster should restore its freq/amp/phase widget values (doesn't restore units or step size yet)

Modified the name/channel passed to AO/DO objects within a DDS object to better reflect what they are (in both the novatech and the pulseblaster)

Redesigned the save front panel state system to be within a separate object. This is only is use via the file->save option, and is currently untested.

Saving and loading at close and startup respectively still uses the old system and should not have changed.

message.raw:
Smart programming for the PulseBlaster. Now checks amplitude, freq, phase and pulse program arrays before programming.
Makes no atttempt to program only the modified amplitude registers. If one amplitude changes there's a complete reprogram of the amlitude registers.
There is presently no way to force a fresh reprogram. Will copy the Novatech DDS9M's implementation of this shortly.

message.raw:
Moved the pulseblaster hardware interface over to the new output classes, which are in output_classes.py.
Also implemented the new pulseblaster buffered programming scheme, which should fix the instability we saw with the previous scheme.
Also moved the buffered programming into the worker class (it was previously in pythonlib/hardware programming/pulseblaster.py).
This commit was a massive cleanup, removing a lot of code made redundant by the change in both buffered and static programming methods.

This is all completely untested as I am not near a control PC! Will test tomorrow.

message.raw:
Fixed bugs with NI PCI 6733 and 6363. Turns out if there wasn't any buffered digital output, the clock signal wouldn't be used properly for the analogue output. This was because the static-mode DO had ownership of the PFI which was being used for clocking.

So now when there is no DO, some empty DO is created. We can make this better in the future by having the task not take ownership of the PFI in the first place. In fact I'll do that soon, it's just complicated by the fact that the port/line syntax and PFI refer to the same terminals, so I have to work out which to skip over.

message.raw:
Workaround to prevent collisions between h5 writes from the camera system and reads in BLACS from other devices.
Camera transitions to buffered mode after all other devices have finished doing so. This change should be reverted once the camera no longer makes writes. By design, no writing should happen until transition_to_static at the end of an experiment.

message.raw: BLACS now deletes the connection table of the settings file prior to saving front panel state on shutdown. This causes the conenction table to be rewritten, even if it has changed. Otherwise if it has changed, the functions that save the front panel state refuse to do so due to the mismatch in connection tables.
